revised_title: A Study on D and E Region Winds over Europe: Wind Profiles from Artificial Luminous Cloud Observations and the Theory of E\lt;sub\gt;s\lt;/sub\gt; Formation based on Wind Shear
tldr: The authors conducted rocket experiments in Europe to study the upper atmosphere wind regime and wind profiles. They analyzed artificial luminous cloud observations to investigate the formation of mid-latitude E\lt;sub\gt;s\lt;/sub\gt; layers based on wind shear. The results showed that the wind-shear theory is valid for the formation of E\lt;sub\gt;s\lt;/sub\gt; layers, but more detailed analysis is needed for heights greater than 110 to 120 km.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
